class_notes: Spring Semester Description: Students are introduced to stylistically and culturally diverse techniques and practices of improvisation. Via creative projects, listening and reading assignments, and interactions with guest artists, students refine listening, performing, and composing skills. We will play during class at least once per week. Students may use any acoustic or electronic instrument, or sing! Pianos, a drum kit, and a few amplifiers are available for use. No previous experience with improvisation required!
course_description:
Student composers and performers learn techniques and practices of
improvisation and study stylistically and culturally diverse perspectives on improvisation to develop listening, performing, and composing skills. We will form a band and rehearse during class at least once per week.
schedule_location: MW 11:30am-12:45pm in BRB Performing Arts Studio
